name: Norwegian Fish Soup (Fiskesuppe)
description: A rich and creamy Norwegian fish soup, featuring a delightful mix of salmon, prawns, and mussels. This hearty main course is simmered with vegetables like carrot, fennel, and leek in a flavourful fish stock and cream base, perfect for a comforting meal.
keywords: Norwegian fish soup, creamy fish soup, salmon soup, seafood chowder, Scandinavian recipe, Bergen fish soup, fiskesuppe, main course, comfort food, dinner, easy seafood recipe, fennel, leek, prawns, mussels, heavy cream, sour cream, dill, chives, potato soup, winter meal

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice carrot, leek and fennel bulb. Saute with the butter in the pot for about 8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep veg

recipeInstructions.text: Add fish stock and simmer with the potatoes for about 8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the fish and prawns into pieces and simmer with the mussels until cooked through. Lower the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the fish

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the heavy cream, sour cream and couple spoons of the broth. Add back to the pot.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cream

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste with vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper and lemon juice. Serve with dill and chives and some sourdough on the side.
recipeInstructions.name: Season and serve

notes: Good with a bit of dry white wine too in the broth. If you're adding it, add it with the fish stock.
I like it with salmon but sub in any fish you like poached. Also any other type of seafood, doesn't have to be mussels and prawn.
